description: First attested from 1547, from Late Latin stupendus (“stunning, amazing”), from the verb stupeō (“(I) am stunned”). Doublet of stupend (which is obsolete), and related to stupor and stupid.

adjectives.description: stupendous (comparative more stupendous, superlative most stupendous)

entries.meaning: Astonishingly great or large; huge; enormous.
examples: One cannot appreciate how stupendous the Matterhorn is without seeing it.

entries.meaning: Of stunning excellence or degree; marvelous.
examples: The renovator created a stupendous new look for our house.
